paper_abstract: We analyze the security notion of information-theoretic secrecy against an adversary who can make C adaptive queries to the decryption oracle, and show that it is equivalent to requiring that the encryption scheme can perfectly encrypt l + 1 different messages. This immediately yields a lower bound on the key length and an optimal construction, namely (l + 1)-wise independent permutations. This also gives an operational interpretation to the notion of decryption oracles in information-theoretic security.
paper_title: Information-Theoretic Secrecy with Access to Decryption Oracles
